Oh nvm I see the alias now -- wishing I thought of that in the original PR

comments.body: Keep the comments about backward compatibility and the release they will no longer be applied associated with the variables

Thank you very much! @liggitt 
I have updated the code.

Likely more context here https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/68267, but it seems the idea was to prevent usage of these labels until kubelet/controllers were applying these labels (in a backwards compatible way). I don't see harm in exporting them now as long as there is a follow up to apply the GA labels where needed (a bunch of cloud specific controllers need this update). @liggitt may have more context here.
There probably needs to be a KEP for how we're going to deprecate the beta labels going forward though?

> There probably needs to be a KEP for how we're going to deprecate the beta labels going forward though?

Yup. See https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/blob/master/keps/sig-node/20190130-node-os-arch-labels.md as a model (assuming the consensus is that they should be promoted)

Thanks @liggitt, I can follow up to write a KEP on this for zone/region, instance types and other cloud-specific ones that need to be addressed. Will leave it up to @thockin and @dims if they want to move these now or wait until we come to a consensus with the KEP.
i feel this PR is just for code re-organization ( moving things around ). yes +1 to a follow up KEP for other things

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@	// GA versions of the legacy beta labels.
	// TODO: update kubelet and controllers to set both beta and GA labels, then export these constants
	labelZoneFailureDomainGA = "failure-domain.kubernetes.io/zone"
	labelZoneRegionGA        = "failure-domain.kubernetes.io/region"
	labelInstanceTypeGA      = "kubernetes.io/instance-type"
